wikipedia_page.main:
Henry Clowes (1 July 1863 – 6 April 1899) was an English cricketer.  Clowes was a right-handed batsman who occasionally fielded as a wicket-keeper.  He was born at Cheadle, Cheshire, and educated at Cheltenham College.
Clowes made his first-class debut for Gloucestershire against Sussex in 1884.  He made three further first-class appearances for the county in that season, the last of which came against Sussex.  In his four first-class appearances for Gloucestershire, Clowes scored a total of 82 runs at an average of 10.25, with a high score of 22.He died at Bloomsbury, London on 6 April 1899.
